did.unittitle: Philadelphia Sunday and Adult School Union records

bioghist.p: The Sunday and Adult School Union was formed in 1817. In that year, a number of Philadelphia-area Sunday school societies met to form a larger union of their societies for the purpose of concentrating their efforts in the support of schools, the publication and dissemination of moral and religious materials, and the formation of new schools. In 1825, the Philadelphia-based Sunday and Adult School Union joined with other regional unions to form the American Sunday School Union (ASSU). In 1939 the ASSU changed its name to the Philadelphia Council of Churches, and in 1969 it again changed names to the Metropolitan Christian Council of Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two volumes of records of the Sunday and Adult School Union. The first volume is a letter book, 1817-1825, which contains correspondence with other Sunday school unions (including requests for publications from the Union and letters about publication exchanges with other societies), and letters to Sabbath school missionaries, discussing duties and remuneration. The second volume contains the constitution and minutes of monthly and annual meetings of the Philadelphia Sunday and Adult School Union, 1817-1824. The minutes discuss collecting books for the Union (including by exchange with other Sunday school societies and unions), fundraising, publication of books, reports from visitations, and additions of members to the Union. The volume also includes a printed copy of a proposed constitution for the American Sunday School Union, 1823, and minutes of the ASSU Missions Committee, 1825-1826.
